body: I got an email that your ICLA file has been accepted. Congratulations!
sorryï¼ŒI don't fully understand what you mean. Maybe you can add markPoint in your series, like this http://echarts.baidu.com/examples/editor.html?c=line-marker

Thanks for helping !

@sxmpasch , Do you have any ideas about width and heigth of text, avoiding the text leaves the screen ?

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39341148/47148285-9a62d900-d2d0-11e8-98fc-3d63d637a249.PNG)

Big thanks !

Sorry, I haven't read your request properly: You set the desired number of decimals with "toFixed()". In your case this would be toFixed(0) since you do not want any decimals...

Regarding the indicators: You just add a "\n" in the text to get a multi-line label. This will help as first step...

Thanks for response.

I cannot use the \N, because i will received automaticaly all text.

It's for this i need a global configuration avoiding the text leaves the screen.

Maybe i need to insert a thing in this part : 

![capture](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/39341148/47148704-b155fb00-d2d1-11e8-8bac-967da5fbb299.PNG)

@sxmpasch, For decimals, it works thanks :)

The last problem is "I want to define the width and heigth of all text, avoiding the text leaves the screen"
Same issue here. To resolve it I set  `notMerge` to `true`  in setOption() as per [ECharts Documentation](https://ecomfe.github.io/echarts-doc/public/en/api.html#echartsInstance.setOption)

My graph updates every second, and when it does, the cursor is no longer hovering over the same data point, so the shown tooltip changes (or disappears, depending on how the graph moves).

I want the tooltip to stay visible, until I move the mouse.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/9970959/47177092-d6586700-d2ed-11e8-8e04-3264e28c250a.png)
same issue here.. mainly on mobile...
Not only on pie charts..

@JoMartinezZhu http://www.echartsjs.com/api.html#echarts
You can check API.Without `refresh` parameters, you can use `setOption.`

> Same issue here. To resolve it I set `notMerge` to `true` in setOption() as per [ECharts Documentation](https://ecomfe.github.io/echarts-doc/public/en/api.html#echartsInstance.setOption)

It does not solve the problem for me.
sorry, we don't have the refresh() interface in ECharts, you can try myChart.setOption().  Now I will close this issue, hoping you understand.

Fixed in https://github.com/apache/incubator-echarts/pull/9195 use `axisLine: { show: false }` to hide.

It is a little complicated about this issue.
First of all, there is a "programming contract" about when and how to use the properies in option to render a chart in echarts:

Tow cases: 

**(A)** 
Basically, properties are retrieved from model (essentially, from "option" in model) directly when rendering in xxxView.
The model cascade mechanism ensure that get the right property.
The "cascade" means, for example: 
+ itemModel - seriesModel (by default)
+ itemModel - categoryModel - seriesModel (in graph)
+ itemModel - levelModel - seriesModel (in tree, treemap, ...ï¼‰
+ ... (other cases)

**(B)** 
If a properties is available to be modified by other components (e.g., `legend`, `visualMap`), 
it will be retrieved in the "visual encoding stage", and be saved to data 
(by `data.setVisual() / data.setItemVisual()`). When chart is finally being rendered in xxxView, it will 
be retrieved from data (by `data.getItemVisual()`). 

---

The "contract" is a little complicated and a little fuzzy. Why not just 
trace them all via `data.set/getItemVisual`? I think there is two reasons: 
(1) A chart needs many properties. If we retrieve them all and save to `data` and finally retrieve from `data` and 
then render, it brings some redundancy of logic and code.
(2) Save obj by the unit of `data item` probably cause performance issue (mainly, GC issue) in large data. 

---


In this case, we have these properties to be considered:
`color`, `opacity`, `symbolSize`, `symbol`, `symbolOffset`, `symbolRotate`, `symbolKeepAspect`.

Probably we have to trade them in different way: 

(1) Follow to the contract (B) above:
`color` (implemented)
`opacity` (not implemented yet, can be implemented in `categoryVisual` like this PR did.ï¼‰
`symbolSize` (not implemented yet, can be implemented in `categoryVisual` like this PR did.)

(2) Follow to the contract (A) above:
`symbolOffset` (implemented)
`symbolRotate` (implemented)
`symbol` (not implemented yet)

(3) 
`symbolKeepAspect` (?)
I am not sure about this property. Currently it has been implemented follow the (A), but
probably it should not be able to modified by other components I think. What your opinion on it ?

Certainly! I have included the option in the original post. 

Explanation: I would like for the x-axis and y-axis names to be set based on the 'rotate' value of the axisLabel property inside xAxis and yAxis.

Justification: This is because sometimes the yAxis or xAxis labels overlaps with the yAxis or xAxis name. This is visually unpleasant, and it should be a standard feature that it automatically sets xAxis.nameGap and yAxis.nameGap so that it is not being overlapped by the axis labels.

How it should look:

![screen shot 2018-10-24 at 9 05 38 am](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/25373337/47412829-03cd6680-d76d-11e8-91c3-e0d149894161.png)

There is a direct reference between legend data and series data item. You cannot use the same name in the legend data. 
If the names have to be the same, just add a ' ' after one of them.
